units.title: Passage hiPS cell colonies
units.text: To passage hiPS cell colonies, cells were incubated with 0.5 mM EDTA and maintained separately in a 24-well plate coated with vitronectin for 7 min at room temperature, resuspended in Essential 8 medium and distributed into new six-well plates.
units.rationale: Describes how to detach and re‑plate hiPS colonies.

units.title: Design and cloning of CRISPR sgRNA library
units.text: The interneuron migration CRISPR sgRNA library was designed by selecting up to five sgRNAs targeting each of the 438 genes of interest (425 NDD genes and 13 genes associated with interneuron development) and an extra 10% ‘safe’ harbour-targeting negative control sgRNAs (Supplementary Table 2)54. Cloning restriction sites and amplification primer handles were appended to each oligo. The sgRNA library oligos were synthesized on the Agilent chip oligo array synthesis platform and cloned into a lentiviral plasmid vector that constitutively expresses the sgRNA and mCherry.
units.rationale: Provides the step‑by‑step creation of the sgRNA library.

units.title: Generation of 3D human cortical organoids (hCO)
units.text: To generate 3D hCO, hiPS cells were dissociated with accutase to obtain a single-cell suspension. About 3 × 10^6 cells were seeded per AggreWell 800 plate well in Essential 8 medium supplemented with the ROCK inhibitor Y27632 (10 µM). The plate was centrifuged at 100g for 3 min and incubated overnight at 37 °C, 5% CO2. The next day (day 0), cellular aggregates were transferred into ultra-low attachment plastic dishes (Corning, catalogue no. 3262) and cultured in Essential 6 medium (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. A1516401) supplemented with dorsomorphin (2.5 µM, Sigma-Aldrich, catalogue no. P5499), SB-431542 (10 µM, R&D Systems, catalogue no. 1614) and XAV-939 (1.25 µM, Tocris, catalogue no. 3748).
units.rationale: Outlines the full protocol for initiating cortical organoid formation.

units.title: Organoid medium change schedule
units.text: From day 6 to 24 with daily medium change in the first 10 days, and the lentivirally integrated sgRNA spacer sequence ... every other day for the subsequent 9 days. From day 25 to day 43, neural medium was supplemented with 20 ng ml−1 brain-derived neurotrophic factor (Peprotech, catalogue no. 450-02) and 20 ng ml−1 NT-3 (Peprotech, catalogue no. 450-03). From day 44, only neural medium without growth factors was used for medium changes every 4 days.
units.rationale: Specifies timing and composition of media replacements during organoid culture.

units.title: Preparation of sequencing libraries from sgRNA‑integrated DNA
units.text: Sample-specific sequencing libraries were prepared from the extracted genomic DNA of each collected sample by amplifying and barcoding the lentivirally integrated sgRNA spacer sequence using the Herculase II Fusion DNA Polymerase (Agilent, catalogue no. 600679). Samples were pooled and sequenced on Illumina NextSeq 550 flow cells at 450–1,000 times read depth.
units.rationale: Details how to generate and sequence sgRNA libraries for screen read‑out.

units.title: Analysis of CRISPR screen results
units.text: Screen results were analysed using the casTLE software54, a maximum likelihood estimator that provides for each gene: a casTLE score, a log-likelihood ratio that considers the relative enrichment or depletion of each gene-targeting sgRNA compared to the distribution of negative control sgRNA effects, a casTLE effect size, a log2-transformed maximum likelihood estimate of the ratio of cells containing sgRNAs targeting a given gene in one sample compared to another, normalized to the median difference of negative controls and no sgRNAs with opposite effects beyond the threshold, were selected as candidates.
units.rationale: Explains the computational pipeline used to interpret the CRISPR screen data.

units.title: Assembly of forebrain assembloids (hFA)
units.text: To generate hFA, hCO and hSO were generated separately and assembled by placing them in close proximity in 24-well low attachment plates (Corning, catalogue no. 3473), which were placed slightly tilted in the incubator. Medium was changed 3 days later. Assembloids were then cultured in the 24-well low attachment plates until day 45.
units.rationale: Describes how to combine cortical and subpallial organoids into a fused assembloid.

units.title: Selection of puromycin‑resistant CAG::Cas9 hiPS colonies
units.text: Once the seeded cells reached 70–80% confluency, 1 µg ml−1 donor for the 1205-4 line was a 30-year-old female; the donor for the 2242-1 line was a 4-year-old male; and the donor for the 1208-2 line was a 20-year-old female. of puromycin in StemFlex medium (Life Technologies, catalogue no. A3349401) was supplemented for 5 days. Colonies were visible at the end of 5 days of selection in puromycin.
units.rationale: Provides the antibiotic selection step to isolate edited hiPS cell clones.
